1.text: Many of us want to become entrepreneurs.

4.text: Starting your own business is one of the biggest dreams of our times.

8.text: But how do you get to be an entrepreneur?

10.text: Most of the advice focuses on the practicalities:

13.text: writing a business plan, raising money, finding staff, marketing and PR.

18.text: We'll go down a different route.

20.text: In our eyes at the heart of successful entrepreneurship lies something oddly more abstract:

27.text: an accurate insight into the causes of human unhappiness.

31.text: To be an entrepreneur means, essentially, to become an expert in the things that make life difficult for people.

38.text: That's because every properly ambitious business is in some way trying to fix things for other people.

45.text: And the bigger and more original what you're trying to fix happens to be, the more successful your business can be.

52.text: Because consumer society is now well developed,

55.text: it may be easy to think that all the big problems out there already have thousands of fixes anyway.

62.text: Think of all those car companies, or pizza outlets, or news websites.

66.text: We surely have enough of everything.

68.text: What could we possibly add to what's already out there?

71.text: But to get a sense of the vast opportunities that still remain in capitalism all you need to do is ask yourself:

77.text: where and in what areas you're unhappy in the course of an average day?

81.text: Every unhappiness is really a new business waiting to be born.

86.text: Your frustrations are a nearly inexhaustible source of raw materials out of which the businesses of the future can be built.

94.text: So while there may already be plenty of breakfast cereals, and t-shirts, and cell phones, and cab rides for sale,

100.text: there's so much more that frustrates and depresses us:

103.text: think of how difficult it is to get on with one's partner, educate children, cope with anxiety,

109.text: discover what you want to do with your life, find a nice place to live, calm down in the evening.

114.text: One could go on and on.

116.text: Our griefs and irritations are endless, thankfully for the budding entrepreneurs.

122.text: The biggest first step to take towards entrepreneurship

125.text: is therefore to learn to study your own unhappiness and what might possibly heal it for you and others.

132.text: When profits decline in businesses it's really the result of too many people throwing themselves at trying to fix the same area

140.text: 'cause they can't think of anything more innovative to do rather than start a new airline, mobile phone company, or supermarket chain.

147.text: And by contrast, healthy profits are a reward for understanding and mastering

152.text: an area of human distress ahead of anyone else.

156.text: Of course ideas aren't enough on their own; you need to take care of practicalities and money

162.text: but they won't help you if your original psychological insight into human unhappiness isn't sound.

168.text: And by the same token, if your insight into what makes people unhappy is razor sharp, and your solutions bold,

177.text: your business will stand a high chance of making money and benefiting humanity too.
